name: Easy Boston Cream Poke Cake
author: Ally Ofstie
summary: By using boxed cake mix and instant pudding, this Boston cream variation is super easy to make and is sure to be a hit at home or for a crowd.
ingredients: 2 (3.5 ounce) packages instant vanilla pudding mix
directions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Beat cake mix, water, eggs, and oil in a large bowl with an electric mixer until combined
Pour batter into the prepared pan
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean, about 30 minutes
Poke holes all over the cake using the handle of a wooden spoon
Whisk milk and pudding mix together in a bowl until just starting to thicken
Pour over cake, spreading with spatula to fill the holes
Place chocolate chips in a glass bowl
Heat heavy whipping cream in a small saucepan over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until bubbles form, about 3 minutes
Pour over the chocolate chips; whisk until smooth
Spread chocolate ganache over cake with a spatula
